page.title: 19LIFE IN CRUCKTON.
page.content: {The small village of Cruckton}is situated on a minor road linking the B4386 and the A488. It is on the site of the Roman Villa.{Cruckton Hall}is a small independent school for teenage maladjusted boys. There is a small crescent of council houses built to house farm labourers for the council farms to the east of the village. The community is dependent upon Hanwood for its nearest shop, church and social activities. The inhabitants are employed on local farms, at Royal Shrewsbury Hospital and elsewhere out of the village. There is a high proportion of retired people and only a few children in the village. Small congregations have caused the closure and recent sale of Cruckton Church. Issues concerning the villagers appear to centre on farming and pensions.
